alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 2:45PM CDT until July 05 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL ORLEANS PARISH... At 245 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Orleans and Arabi. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 234 and 241. Interstate 610 between mile markers 2 and 4. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
